intro: Alyxia stellata var. fatuhivensis, commonly known as the Fatuhivensis Alyxia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. This variant is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
